column4: Halp. I triple boot WinXP, Win7, and Ubuntu. The partitions for Win7 and Ubuntu are on /dev/sda, and WinXP is located on /dev/sdb. After installing Lucid, it detects all of the OS's but after it finishes, it ONLY boots to WinXP - no grub selection.
so grub wont install at all?
well...that's the thing. It *says* that it installs...but it doesn't seem to. I've tried this with two different discs, the desktop and alt installers
and xp loader ntldr works ok ? , do you use any mbr managmnet tools on xp?
how? How to I tell Ubuntu to use lilo instead during the install?
sorry, I stepped away for a moment. What was it you were trying to get me to do?
what i was wondering was if grubs config. ok, partition numbers match
how do you install grub from live cd?
just by going through the normal install...
it gives proper way of installing it
